entry.title: Yesterday's Jam
entry.summary: The unloved and socially-awkward Roy and Moss give computer-illiterate Jen a less than lukewarm welcome to the IT department. Soon, however, they realise a female presence in their team can have its benefits...

entry.title: Calamity Jen
entry.summary: The team face their first test during Reynholm Industries' so-called 'war on stress'. Roy has an attack of kleptomania, Jen's shoes don't fit, and Moss sends round a strongly-worded e-mail about an office fire.

Jen has a new admirer, but her inability to tell the truth results in a very public humiliation. Meanwhile, Roy decides to improve his love life by adopting a sterner attitude to the fairer sex, and Moss is on hand to recommend a very romantic restaurant.

entry.title: The Red Door
entry.summary: What lies behind the mysterious red door in the IT department? What has happened to Moss's new mug? And why is Roy in danger of becoming known as a 'desk rabbit'?

entry.title: The Haunting of Bill Crouse
entry.summary: Moss goes to extraordinary lengths to help Jen escape the unwanted attention of potential suitor Bill Crouse. These lengths include Jen's untimely death...

entry.title: Aunt Irma Visits
entry.summary: Jen is subject to very powerful mood swings around a certain time every month, and Moss and Roy start to display similar symptoms. A big bar of chocolate, Dirty Dancing on DVD and a girly night out might be the cure...

entry.title: The Work Outing
entry.summary: Jen's heart soars when 'Philip from Six' descends to the basement to borrow her copy of Heat - and invites her to the theatre. Bur her hopes of finding true love are dashed when Roy and Moss invite themselves along, turning her hot date into a lukewarm work outing.

entry.title: Return of the Golden Child
entry.summary: Denholm's death means trouble for Jen, Roy and Moss, until support appears in the form of a mysterious, albeit libidinous, stranger. Elsewhere, Moss finds a website that takes people's personal details and calculates when they will die. So he tries it out on Roy...

entry.title: Moss and the German
entry.summary: Jen tries to escape the romantic attentions of Douglas, and Roy tries to watch a film. Elsewhere, Moss' attempt to meet new people backfires dramatically when he answers an online ad for a cookery course
entry.dc:relation.Guidance: Adult humour with some strong language

entry.title: The Dinner Party
entry.summary: Jen's hopes for a sophisticated and classy dinner party are dashed when she has to invite Roy, Moss and Richmond. What already promises to be a shaky evening takes a turn for the worse when for some reason Roy finds something hilarious about the name of her new boyfriend - Peter File.

entry.title: Smoke and Mirrors
entry.summary: Sexual tension rears its saucy head in the basement this week, when Jen's ill-fitting bra starts an unfortunate chain of events that leads to Moss appearing on Newsnight and the gang entering The Dragon's Den.

entry.title: Men Without Women
entry.summary: Despite his graveside promises to Denholm never again to become embroiled in a sexual harassment case, Jen's voice awakens a mighty tiger behind Douglas' fly and he can resist her no longer. He hires Jen as his new PA, giving Moss and Roy free rein in the office. How will they cope without her, and how will she cope with Douglas's unwelcome advances?

entry.title: From Hell
entry.summary: While boss Douglas does his best to run Reynholm Industries into the ground, Jen has to deal with a builder from Hell, Roy loses 20 quid and Moss learns how to stand up to ruffians.

entry.title: Are We Not Men?
entry.summary: A new football website allows Roy and Moss to pass as 'proper' men for a momentous couple of days. Meanwhile, Jen is trying to date a man who looks like a magician.

entry.title: Tramps Like Us
entry.summary: Jen, Roy and Moss find their lives moving in different directions after a disappointing settlement to a sexual harassment suit. Jen seeks pastures new, and Roy ends up out in the cold.
entry.dc:relation.Guidance: Some strong language and adult humour

entry.title: Speech
entry.summary: As 'Employee of the Month', Jen asserts herself as manager and makes powerful enemies in Moss and Roy. Meanwhile, Douglas finds the love of his life is not all that she appears to be.

entry.title: Friendface
entry.summary: Jen introduces Roy and Moss to a new social networking website, and then finds out why some friendships are best left in the past.
entry.dc:relation.Guidance: Some strong language and adult humour

entry.title: Calendar Geeks
entry.summary: In the final episode of the series, Reynholm Industries are proud to announce their first sexy nude calendar. Enough said, probably.

entry.title: Jen the Fredo
entry.summary: Jen wants to stretch herself in the workplace so applies for the post of Entertainment Manager. But when she finds out that amusing her boss Douglas' business connections has its darker side, she has to turn to Moss and Roy for help.

entry.title: The Final Countdown
entry.summary: Moss becomes a celebrity by beating all records on a popular puzzle show...at the other end of human life Roy is mistaken for a window cleaner, while Jen is preoccupied with Douglas' secret meetings with lots of women in fluffy dressing gowns.

entry.title: Something Happened
entry.summary: Douglas becomes a Spaceologist, Roy's life is changed by a bad back, and Jen gets involved with a rock band.

entry.title: Italian for Beginners
entry.summary: Roy gets obsessed by his latest girlfriend's sad family history, while Jen tells an absolute whopper to get some attention.

entry.title: Bad Boys
entry.summary: Roy and Moss become juvenile delinquents for the day and have an uncomfortable experience at a shopping centre.

entry.title: Reynholm vs Reynholm
entry.summary: Douglas finds marriage agrees with him - for all of two weeks. When it all blows up his entire fortune is at stake - so it's up to Jen, Roy, Moss and one other mysterious Reynholm Industries employee to help him out...
